name: iterate
info:
# Iterate

This node is for making it easier to loop a message through a refinement process.

It takes an "iterations" argument, default 1.

the message will go to the first output "iterations" number of times, and then exit through the second output.

name: function 1

msg.history = [msg.history[env.get('start')],msg.history[msg.history.length - 1]]
return msg;

name: Filter Valid Nodes
Analyze Subflows
func: const currentSubflows=msg.payload.filter(node=>node.type.startsWith('subflow:'));const updatedSubflows=[];const lastKnownVersions=context.get('lastKnownVersions')||{};currentSubflows.forEach(subflow=>{const{id,type,version}=subflow;const lastVersion=lastKnownVersions[id];if(!lastVersion||lastVersion!==version){updatedSubflows.push(subflow);lastKnownVersions[id]=version;}});context.set('lastKnownVersions',lastKnownVersions);msg.updatedSubflows=updatedSubflows;return msg;

name: WriteToFileFunction

props.v: I need a subflow that will read flows.json file as a json array, parse it,sort by obj.name, and then write the file back. it should also make a backup file in case of error.
Please output the entire node-red flow.
Please output the entire node-red flow.

name: requirements
template:
I need a node-red subflow that will take as input a flat node-red export of nodes and return a dependency graph of all the subflows within.

it should expect msg.payload of the input to be a javascript array of nodes.

ignore any nodes that are not themselves a subflow definition, instance, or part of a subflow.

a node that is a subflow definition will have "type" of "subflow"

a node that is part of a subflow will have a 'z' property that is the id of the subflow node

a node that is an instance of a subflow will have 'type' property that is 'subflow:{SUBFLOW_ID}' with {SUBFLOW_ID} being the id of the subflow definition node

the subflow you write should output a single array of objects with the following properties:

id: id of the subflow
nodes: clones of all the the nodes in the subflow, including other subflow instances.
subflows: count of how many of the nodes in the subflow are themselves instances of subflows

props.v: Please output the entire node-red flow.

name: 3-way switch
payload: greater than or equals to 100, less than 100, else

name: 8-way switch
payload: contains "wind", contains "holy", contains "fire", contains "ice", contains "earth", contains "lightning", contains "posion", otherwise

name: sanitize

props.v: the subflow should have two outputs. it should check the msg object for the 'iteration' property. if it's unset, set it to 1, if it's 3 or greater, pass the msg to the second output. if it's less than 3, increment it and set the payload to "please review and improve your work. respond with the complete improved result, obeying the same formatting rules."

name: requirements
subflows
template:
I need a node-red node according to the following specification:

1. Function node (Prepare Subflow Data):
   - Prepare the subflow data as a JSON string.
   - Set `msg.headers` with the appropriate "Content-Type" for the IPFS API request.
   - Set `msg.payload` to the JSON string of the subflow data.
   - Set `msg.url` to the IPFS API endpoint for adding data (`"http://localhost:5001/api/v0/add"`).

name: subflows
template:
I need a node red subflow that will accept a payload object with an id property

the payload should be stringified (human readable) and written to [id].json, in a directory specifiable by environment variable on the subflow

name: subflows
template: I need a node red subflow that will

Subflow Name: Monitor Flows.json

Description: Monitors the local flows.json file for changes and emits the parsed JSON content when a change is detected.

Input:

No input is required for this subflow.
Output:

msg.payload: The parsed JSON content of the updated flows.json file.
Nodes:

"inject" node (Start monitoring):

Name: Start monitoring
Payload: none
Repeat: none (trigger only once)
Output: 1
"watch" node (Watch flows.json):

Name: Watch flows.json
Filename: Path to the local flows.json file
Event type: Change
Output: 1
"file in" node (Read flows.json):

Name: Read flows.json
Filename: Mustache template with {{{msg.filename}}}
Output: string
Send message on: file change
Output: 1
"json" node (Parse JSON content):

Name: Parse JSON content
Action: Convert between JSON string & object
Property: msg.payload
Output: 1
"join" node (Join initial trigger and file watch events):

Name: Join events
Mode: Automatic
Build: merged object
Output: 1
Flow Connections:

Connect the "Start monitoring" node to the "Read flows.json" node.
Connect the "Watch flows.json" node to the "Read flows.json" node.
Connect the "Read flows.json" node to the "Parse JSON content" node.
Connect the "Parse JSON content" node to the "Join events" node.
Connect the "Join events" node to the subflow output.
This subflow, when added to a flow, will start monitoring the local flows.json file and emit the parsed JSON content as msg.payload whenever there's a change detected in the file.

info:
This example uses the default blank template.

It does not use any front-end framework, just
pure HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

template:
This is the payload:

{{payload.mystring}},

{{payload.mynumber}}.

payload: A am a new list entry

name: Add a Form
info:
Creates an example form showing off different features.

No buttons are included so that the `uib-element` node
automatically creates the two "Send" and "Reset" default
buttons for you.

Email & Data inputs are marked as required but left with
no default value to show the invalid field/form highlights.

name:
Limitation: we have to resend everything just to update one thing. 
 Instead, consider using this to create the HTML then copy the HTML using your browser's developer tools 
 then save the HTML into the index.html file. 
 You can still update using a uib-element node with the same ID or you can use a uib-update node as appropriate.
Plain DL List (Array)
payload: [["Entry One","Description One"],["Entry Two","Description Two a","Description Two b","Description Two c"],["Entry Three","Description Three"],["Entry Four","Description Four"]]

name: Plain DL List (List of Objects)
payload: [{"Entry 1":"Description 1"},{"Entry 2a":"Description 2a","Entry 2b":"Description 2b - this wont show. Use List not object for multiple Descriptions."},{"Entry 3":["Description 3 a","Description 3 b"]},{"Entry 4":"Description 4"}]

name: Plain DL List (Object of Objects)
payload: {"ONE":{"A":"LI One A"},"TWO":{"B":["LI Two B1","LI Two B2"]},"THREE":{"C":{"C1":"LI Three C1","C2":"LI Three C2"}}}

name: Plain UL/OL List (Array)
payload: ["LI One","LI Two",["LI Three a","LI Three b"],"LI Four"]

name: Plain UL/OL List (Object)
payload: {"L1":"LI One","L2":"LI Two","L3":"LI Three a","L4":["LI Four a","LI Four b"]}

name: Reload
info:
Sends a pre-formatted msg to the front-end that
causes the page to reload itself.

name: Send a msg
info:
Send a simply msg to the front-end.

The default front-end template code will display the msg
using HTML formatting, no coding required.

name: Send the UL/OL list and change the Parent to `#eltest-ul-ol *[data-row-index="3"]` \n (without the quotes) to insert the table into the list entry #3
uibuilder control output
info:
This shows the data coming out of the
uibuilder node's Port #2 (bottom) which is
the control output.

Here you will see any control msg either sent
by the node itself or from the front-end library.

For example the "client disconnect" and
"client connect" messages. Or the "visibility"
messages from the client.

Loop the "client connect", "cache replay" and
"cache clear" messages back to a `uib-cache`
node before the input to uibuilder in order
to control the output of the cache.

name: uibuilder standard output
info:
This shows the data coming out of the
uibuilder node's Port #1 (top) which is
the standard output.

Here you will see any standard msg sent from
your front-end code.

name: Zero-Code Examples. Flows for all uib-element types
